title: Vinnie Jones 'saves' Celebrity X Factor singing for late wife Tanya's legacy
text:

Vinnie Jones has been praised for 'saving' tonight's first X Factor : Celebrity live show.

After some shambolic performances, the former footballer took the roof off with his powerful rendition of ‘Everybody Needs Somebody’ by The Blues Brothers.

Before he took to the stage, emotional Vinnie revealed he was singing for late wife Tanya's legacy.

Vinnie, 54, who joined the show just weeks after Tanya died at the age of 53, said: "Soon after Tans passed decided I have to do it for her legacy and in her name will try and win this. The main thing overlooking me is Tans."

Simon Cowell thanked Vinnie for taking part and for turning the lacklustre live show around as the crowd chanted his name.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

The judge said: "You know what Vinnie, I would say after that there is a shot you could actually win this competition. That was so much fun.

"I have so much respect for you as a man and everything you've been through, I know it's been tough. I cannot thank you enough. I thought you brought the show to life in this moment when we needed it.

"I know you’re a hard man but you’ve got a soft inside. A great heart. Snd really played to your strengths."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

X Factor viewers flocked to Twitter after watching Vinnie's sensational performance.

One viewer said: "Vinnie Jones has just single handily saved Celebrity X Factor. A celebrity is someone who people want to celebrate... that’s exactly what he is."

"Vinnie Jones is just class really isn’t he," added another.

A third said: "Gotta love Vinnie, he dared to dream when he was young & then lived the dream through hard work & determination."

"Vinnie Jones has just become my new favourite person ever," said a fourth.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Vinnie admitted things may get emotional later on in the series as he will sing some of wife Tanya’s favourite songs as a tribute.

He told the Mirror: "There’s one song that I like, which I might be singing. It’s one that means a lot to us. I can see her now looking out the window of the car tapping along to it. There are a lot of songs that mean a lot to us.

"I’m not treating it like a singing competition, I’m doing it as a tribute for Tanya."

It is understood he has been rehearsing Everybody Needs Somebody To Love for the opening show, but may perform more tearjerking tracks later in the series.

Vinnie has vowed to give any X Factor winnings to the hospitals that cared for his late wife, Harefield hospital and Cedars Sinai.

(Image: Getty)

(Image: Twitter)

He added: “I’ve got a song that I could get emotional to, but Tanya wouldn’t want me to crack up. It’s a ballad, an Irish song, it’s basically about me and her. So it’s a sad song.

"If I can get through that, I think that could bring the house down.

"The biggest part of doing X Factor was Tanya. She loved the show, she thought it would be brilliant. I’m like, ‘No no, really?’ She was like ‘yeah you’ll be brilliant, I love it,’ then my daughter jumped in, Kaley, and she’s like you’ve got to do it.

"It gave Tanya something to look forward to, to come over to London and get well for.

"Sadly it was a bridge too far for her."

*The X Factor: Celebrity airs Saturday on ITV at 8.20pm
description: The former footballer inspired X Factor: Celebrity viewers with his uplifting performance in tribute to Tanya
